intro: Marlierea spiciflora, commonly known as the spicate marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and blooms.
